ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Kunark system specs
ygData.msgSnippet: I m running a PIII 450, 128 Mb ram and a Voodoo 2 2000.  I only have a problem in zones like Warsliks Woods where the trees are real dense.  I have to lower
ygData.messageBody:
I'm running a PIII 450, 128 Mb ram and a Voodoo 2 2000. I only have a problem in zones like Warsliks Woods where the trees are real dense.  I have to lower the clipping plane to enjoy my normal frame rate, but it is still playable at the max clipping plane.  I don't know what might be slowing your frame rate, but you should have better performance than me.
 
Orcen
Cazic-Thule
-----Original Message-----
From: Nat Russo [mailto:nrusso@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 11, 2000 10:44 AM
To: EQ_Necromancers
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Kunark system specs

Hi again folks,

Something has been bugging me about this Kunark expansion, and I wanted to
check in with you guys to see if you're having the same problems.

My system is a PIII 600Mhz.  128Mb ram.  I'm running a 32Mb Diamond Ultra
V770D (Riva TnT2 chipset).  I have a 20.4 gig hard drive.

Now for the problem.  In order for the game to be playable whenever I'm in
Kunark, I have to COMPLETELY lower the clipping plane, and change some of
the other settings (like particle density, etc).  If I do not do this, I get
the framerate from HELL.

So tell me...did Verant just COMPLETELY drop the ball on the minimum system
requirements?  Anyone with a similar configuration having the same problem?

Thanks,
Mujahid
